arm_group.description: adults prescribed daily oral antiretroviral preexposure prophylaxis (PrEP) with the coformulated TDF/FTC  to reduce HIV acquisition.

brief_summary.textblock:
A health services implementation pilot study, conducted with an observational cohort of
      HIV-uninfected persons including men who have sex with men,  heterosexual women and men, and
      injection drug users receiving daily oral antiretroviral preexposure prophylaxis (PrEP) at
      four federally qualified health centers that provide sexual health and primary care services
      to communities with high HIV incidence/prevalence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sustainable Healthcenter Implementation PrEP Pilot Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult

          -  documented without HIV infection (acute or established)

          -  report sexual behaviors that indicate substantial risk of HIV acquisition

          -  report injection-related behaviors that indicate substantial risk of HIV acquisition

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  <18 years of age

          -  documented HIV infection (acute or established)

study_pop.textblock:
1200 adult men who have sex with men, injection drug users, and heterosexually-active men
        and women who are at substantial risk of acquiring HIV infection and initiate the use of
        daily oral antiretroviral preexposure prophylaxis (PrEP) with TDF/FTC

intervention.description: Daily oral dose of coformulated TDF/FTC

link.description: Link to CDC information about preexposure prophylaxis

facility.name: Access Community Health Network - Grand Boulevard Health and Specialty Center
Newark Community Health Centers - Ludlow St. Clinic
Central Care Community Health Centers - MLK Boulevard Clinic

clinical_study.official_title: Sustainable Healthcenter Implementation PrEP Pilot Study

overall_contact.last_name: Dawn K Smith, MD, MS, MPH

overall_official.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
overall_official.last_name: Dawn K Smith, MD, MS, MPH

primary_outcome.description: Side effects, rates of renal adverse events, rates of atraumatic bone fractures, HIV infections with/without virus with mutations associated with TDF or FTC resistance, documented at clinical visits while prescribed PrEP
Self-reported medication adherence and detection of tenofovir in dried blood spots at each clinical visit while prescribed PrEP
Trends in sexual and injection HIV acquisition risk behaviors among patients  measured at each clinic visit while prescribed PrEP

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
responsible_party.investigator_title: Biomedical Interventions Activity Lead, Epidemiology Branch, DHAP, NCHHSTP

secondary_outcome.description: Source of payment, cost, and reimbusement for medication and clinical care associated with each clinical visit for PrEP
Variation in clinical practices at each clinic visit for PrEP-related care relative to PHS PrEP guidelines, and the relationship of clinical practices to patient outcomes

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
